alert.note: Alert for Bath; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 28 at 4:09AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Powell, southeastern Montgomery, southern Bath and southwestern Menifee Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 409 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stanton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stanton, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Bowen, Fagan, Cedar Groves, Cornwell, Bean, Clay Lick and Lucky Stop around 415 AM EDT. Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Tabor, Hope, Rothwell and Haystack around 420 AM EDT. Walkers Crossing around 425 AM EDT. THIS INCLUDES Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 13 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
